title: PHPcaseKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPcaseKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Use
case
to run some code when a variable has a specified value:
<?php
$a = 3;
switch($a) {
case 1:
echo "One";
break;
case 2:
echo "Two";
break;
case 3:
echo "Three";
break;
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
case
keyword is used to jump to a line of code when an expression has a specific
value in a
switch
conditional.
Related Pages
The
switch
keyword.
Read more about the switch conditional in our
PHP switch Statement Tutorial
.

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Complete the Code 1
practice_exercises.description: Fill in the missing line to make this code work.
practice_exercises.starter_code:
<?php
$a = 3;
switch($a) {
case 1:
echo "One";
break;
case 2:
echo "Two";
break;
# TODO: Complete this line
echo "Three";
break;
}
?>
practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
$a = 3;
switch($a) {
case 1:
echo "One";
break;
case 2:
echo "Two";
break;
case 3:
echo "Three";
break;
}
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPcaseKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPcaseKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPcaseKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
